szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.game

Class ActorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.game.ActorManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActorManagerBasic, ActorManagerPrivileged, ActorManagerUpdatable, GameUpdater, ResettableGameClass

    public class ActorManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActorManagerPrivileged
    The managing class for all actors except pipe heads and pipe segments.

    • Method Detail

      • getActors

        public java.util.Set<ActorBasic> getActors()
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerBasic
        Gets the set of all active game actors.
        Specified by:
        getActors in interface ActorManagerBasic
        Returns:
        all game actors (except the pipe heads and pipe segments) as an unmodifiable set

      • getActorsBySearchCriteria

        public java.util.Set<ActorBasic> getActorsBySearchCriteria(java.util.function.Predicate<ActorBasic> predicate)
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerBasic

        Queries the set of all currently active game actors (meaning actors whose act() method is still called) except pipe heads and pipe segments and returns a subset of them satisfying the criteria passed as argument. If no criteria is passed (null is passed) it returns all game actors.

        If getActorsByType or getPositionToActorsMap does not satisfy your particular search criteria, this is a generic search method, but beware, unlike those other methods, this method has a complexity of O(n), where n is the number of active game actors, minus pipe segments and pipe heads.

        Specified by:
        getActorsBySearchCriteria in interface ActorManagerBasic
        Parameters:
        predicate - a functional interface or lambda function used in evaluating whether the actor should be included in the query results. If null is passed, all game actors are returned.
        Returns:
        a set of all game actors satisfying the criteria specified.

      • getActorsByType

        public java.util.Set<ActorBasic> getActorsByType(ActorType type)
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerBasic
        Gets all active game actors which are of a given ActorType.
        Specified by:
        getActorsByType in interface ActorManagerBasic
        Parameters:
        type - the actor type of the actors desired.
        Returns:
        a set of all active game actors for whom ActorBasic.getType() == type. If type == ActorType.PIPESEGMENT || type == ActorType.PIPEHEAD, then an empty set is returned.

      • getPositionToActorsMap

        public java.util.Map<TunnelCellBasic,java.util.Set<ActorBasic>> getPositionToActorsMap()
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerBasic
        Gets a mapping between tunnel cells and all actors (except pipe segments or pipe heads) located at the particular tunnel cell

        Note that no actors of types ActorType.PIPESEGMENT or ActorType.PIPEHEAD are stored and handled by the actor manager; if a query for these is performed, the returned result is an empty set.

        Specified by:
        getPositionToActorsMap in interface ActorManagerBasic
        Returns:
        a mapping between actors' current positions and actors themselves

      • registerActor

        public void registerActor(ActorPrivileged actor,
                          java.lang.Runnable action)
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerUpdatable
        Registers an actor, thereby adding the actor to the game level. Also optionally sets a method (an action) that is to be called (performed) when the actor given as argument is unregistered, that is, removed from the game level.
        Specified by:
        registerActor in interface ActorManagerUpdatable
        Parameters:
        actor - Not Null: The actor to add to the game level.
        action - Optional: The action to be performed when the actor is unregistered, Must be a reference to a method returning void and taking no arguments or null if nothing is to be performed on a given actors removal.

      • unregisterActor

        public void unregisterActor(ActorBasic actor)
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerUpdatable
        Unregisters an actor (removing from it from the game, in the sense that its act() method is no longer called), Note that the actual implementation can use late removal to prevent ConcurrentModificationException. Optionally also executes a method that is to be called when the actor is unregistered if such a method has been set, otherwise it does nothing.
        Specified by:
        unregisterActor in interface ActorManagerUpdatable
        Parameters:
        actor - Not Null: The actor to remove

      • update

        public void update()
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerPrivileged
        Updates all game actors (except actors unregistered in the previous turn),
        Specified by:
        update in interface ActorManagerPrivileged
        Specified by:
        update in interface GameUpdater

      • getUnregisteredActors

        public java.util.Set<UnregisteredActorInfo> getUnregisteredActors()
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerPrivileged
        Gets a map of all unregistered actors (those whose update() method is not called anymore) and a value detailing for how many game loop iterations they have been unregistered (only kept for N further iterations, where N is arbitrary). Primarily, these values serve for effects rendering when an actor is removed.
        Specified by:
        getUnregisteredActors in interface ActorManagerPrivileged
        Returns:
        a mapping between unregistered actors and the number of turns since it was unregistered.

      • startNewGame

        public void startNewGame(GameLevelPrivileged gameLevel,
                         DummyLevel level)
        Description copied from interface: ResettableGameClass
        Performs the actions to reset the implementing class to its default state when a new game level begins.
        Specified by:
        startNewGame in interface ResettableGameClass
        Parameters:
        gameLevel - the object representing the current game level
        level - the value object containing additional information to initiazlize the current game level
